session.name: Liberty Index 2024 - U.S. House
session.description: Created by the Republican Liberty Caucus, the 2024 Liberty Index is a liberty-focused legislative scorecard for the U.S. House. The Liberty Index scores Republican members of Congress on 20 pivotal bills/votes from 2024 that either advance liberty or diminish liberty.

bills.title: This continuing resolution funds the federal government for another two months, through March 2024, at current spending levels
bills.description: This continuing resolution funds the federal government for another two months, through March 2024, at current spending levels. With $36 trillion in debt, this fiscally irresponsible measure kicks the can down the road without any spending cuts.
bills.vote_result_summary: Passed House 314-108 on 1/18/24, Passed Senate 77-18 on 1/18/24, Signed by President

bills.title: The Extension of Continuing Appropriations and Other Matters Act
bills.description: The Extension of Continuing Appropriations and Other Matters Act. This continuing resolution funds the federal government from 3/8/24 to 3/22/24, at current spending levels. With $36 trillion in debt, this fiscally irresponsible measure kicks the can down the road without any spending cuts.
bills.vote_result_summary: Passed House 320-99 on 2/29/24, Passed Senate 77-13 on 2/29/24, Signed by President

bills.title: The Consolidated Appropriations Act, which appropriates $468 billion in new spending
bills.description: The Consolidated Appropriations Act, which appropriates $468 billion in new spending. This bill also funds about 30 percent of the federal government, including the Departments of Justice, Transportation, Energy, Agriculture, Commerce, Interior, Veterans Affairs, Housing and Urban Development, the Environmental Protection Agency, and the Food and Drug Administration. The bill also funds a massive new FBI building, along with an ATF pistol brace ban. This fiscally irresponsible omnibus bill enables big government to continue wasting taxpayer dollars while treading on our liberties.
bills.vote_result_summary: Passed House 339-85 on 3/6/24, Passed Senate 75-22 on 3/8/24, Signed by President

bills.title: The Protecting Americans from Foreign Adversary Controlled Applications Act
bills.description: The Protecting Americans from Foreign Adversary Controlled Applications Act. This bill gives the President authority to ban a social media company owned by a foreign adversary. This bill was designed to have the executive branch ban TikTok. This gives the President too much power, it violates free market principles and it infringes on our First Amendment right to freedom of speech.
bills.vote_result_summary: Passed House 352-65 on 3/13/24, Held in Senate

bills.title: The Further Consolidated Appropriations Act
bills.description: The Further Consolidated Appropriations Act. This $1.2 trillion omnibus bill funds the following federal departments through FY24: Department of Education, Department of Defense, Department of Homeland Security, Department of Labor, Department of Health and Human Services, Department of State, and the Legislative Branch. With $36 trillion in debt, this massive spending bill is fiscally irresponsible.
bills.vote_result_summary: Passed House 286-134, Passed Senate 74-24, Signed by President

bills.title: The Reforming Intelligence and Securing America Act, which extends the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act for another five years
bills.description: The Reforming Intelligence and Securing America Act, which extends the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act for another five years. This bill allows the federal

bills.title: The Reforming Intelligence and Securing America Act, which extends the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act for another five years
bills.description: The Reforming Intelligence and Securing America Act, which extends the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act for another five years. This bill allows the federal government to continue to violate our 4th Amendment privacy rights by enabling warrantless surveillance under FISA.
bills.vote_result_summary: Passed House 273-147 on 4/12/24, Passed Senate 60-34 on 4/20/24, Signed by President

bills.title: Reconsider H
bills.description: Reconsider H.R.7888              table the motion to reconsider prevented members of the House from having that opportunity to kill the FISA bill.

bills.title: This measure allowed the House to combine four separate foreign aid bills, concurring with the Senate version of H
bills.description: This measure allowed the House to combine four separate foreign aid bills, concurring with the Senate version of H.R. 815. The package appropriated a total of $97 billion in foreign aid for Ukraine, Israel, and Indo-Pacific allies. This legislation also imposed sanctions on Iran and Russia, while banning TikTok.
bills.vote_result_summary: Passed House 316-94 on 4/19/24, Passed Senate 79-18 on 4/23/24, Signed by President

bills.title: The 21st Century Peace Through Strength Act
bills.description: The 21st Century Peace Through Strength Act. This bill would have imposed sanctions on Iran and Russia, needlessly inserting the United States into undeclared wars which do not involve the U.S. Additionally, the bill would ban TikTok by forcing the owners to sell, a violation of free market principles and free speech.

bills.title: The Ukraine Security Supplemental Appropriations Act, which would appropriate an additional $61 billion in foreign aid to Ukraine
bills.description: The Ukraine Security Supplemental Appropriations Act, which would appropriate an additional $61 billion in foreign aid to Ukraine. With $36 trillion in debt, it is fiscally irresponsible to send taxpayer dollars overseas for foreign aid. Also, by sending foreign aid, the bill needlessly inserts the United States into an undeclared war which does not involve the U.S.

bills.title: The Israel Security Supplemental Appropriations Act, which would appropriate an additional $26
bills.description: The Israel Security Supplemental Appropriations Act, which would appropriate an additional $26.3 billion in foreign aid to Israel. With $36 trillion in debt, it is fiscally irresponsible to send taxpayer dollars overseas for foreign aid.

bills.title: The Carbon Sequestration Collaboration Act, which expands the Department of Energy's carbon sequestration/storage program
bills.description: The Carbon Sequestration Collaboration Act, which expands the Department of Energy's carbon sequestration/storage program. This bill grows federal bureaucracy at the expense of the taxpayers, estimated to cost $31 million over the next four years. With $36 trillion in debt, this unnecessary spending increase is fiscally irresponsible.

bills.title: The Anti-Semitism Awareness Act
bills.description: The Anti-Semitism Awareness Act. This bill is a blatant violation of our First Amendment right to freedom of speech. It directs the federal government to adopt an overbroad definition of anti-semitism, which could allow individuals, businesses and colleges to be prosecuted for criticizing Israel's military operations. Regardless, of one's opinion on Israel, we should always defend Americans' inalienable, constituional right to free speech.

bills.title: The CBDC Anti-Surveillance State Act, which would prohibit the Federal Reserve from issuing a central bank digital currency without congressional authorization
bills.description: The CBDC Anti-Surveillance State Act, which would prohibit the Federal Reserve from issuing a central bank digital currency without congressional authorization.
bills.vote_result_summary: Passed House 216-192 on 5/23/24, Held in Senate

bills.title: The NASA Reauthorization Act, which appropriates $26 billion to continue funding NASA in FY25
bills.description: The NASA Reauthorization Act, which appropriates $26 billion to continue funding NASA in FY25. With $36 trillion in debt, this spending is fiscally irresponsible. To save taxpayer money, much of NASA's activities could be left up to the private sector.

bills.title: The Continuing Appropriations and Extensions Act
bills.description: The Continuing Appropriations and Extensions Act. This continuing resolution continues to fund the federal government at current spending levels for three months, through 12/20/24. With $36 trillion in debt, this fiscally irresponsible measure kicks the can down the road without any spending cuts.
bills.vote_result_summary: Passed House 341-82 on 9/25/24, Passed Senate 78-18 on 9/25/24, Signed by President

bills.title: The National Defense Authorization Act for FY25
bills.description: The National Defense Authorization Act for FY25. This 1,800 page bill appropriates $895 billion for the military budget, a $9 billion increase. With $36 trillion in debt, it is fiscally irresponsible to give this much taxpayer money to a department that has failed its audit seven years in a row. Among the waste in the NDAA is $500 million for foriegn aid, while allowing taxpayer money to fund travel costs for federal employees to receive abortions.
bills.vote_result_summary: Passed House 281-140 on 12/11/24, Passed Senate 85-14 on 12/18/24, Signed by President

bills.title: The second version of the American Relief Act
bills.description: The second version of the American Relief Act. This 1,557 page bill funds the federal government for three months through 3/14/25. In short, it approves over $1 trillion in spending, including a $110 billion spending increase. Even worse, the bill would suspend the debt limit until 2027, giving Congress two full years to spend away taxpayer money with no restraints. This omnibus bill is fiscally irresponsible and reckless.

bills.title: The third version of the American Relief Act
bills.description: The third version of the American Relief Act. This continuing resolution funds the federal government for three months through 3/14/25. It approves over $1 trillion in spending, including a $110 billion spending increase. With $36 trillion in debt, this bill is fiscally irresponsible.
bills.vote_result_summary: Passed House 366-34 on 12/20/24, Passed Senate 85-11 on 12/21/24, Signed by President

bills.title: The Federal Reserve Board Abolition Act, which would abolish the Federal Reserve
bills.description: The Federal Reserve Board Abolition Act, which would abolish the Federal Reserve. (This bill has not moved, but cosponsors were awared two bonus points)
